newsitem.title: USA: Paper says Russia sells missiles to Iran.
newsitem.headline: Paper says Russia sells missiles to Iran.

text.p: Russia is selling air-defence missile systems to Iran, the Washington Times reported on Wednesday.
The reported sales would be an apparent violation of a pledge President Boris Yeltsin made to block new sales of Russian arms to Iran.
The newspaper said that Iran planned to give a small Russian-made anti-aircraft missile to Hizbollah guerrillas, the pro-Iranian group based in Lebanon.

It quoted intelligence sources as saying that in talks over the past two months, Russian arms dealers offered to sell up to 500 advanced "Igla" anti-aircraft missiles worth over $50,000 each at discount prices.
The sources identified the missiles as SA-18s.
The Times said that other deals between Russia and Iran included the sale of T-72 tanks and Mi-17 transport helicopters.
Yeltsin promised U.S. President Bill Clinton in 1994 to block all new conventional arms sales to Iran.
